Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CATH-2 (Cathelicidin 2, natural AMPs; birds, animals; XXA)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: Sequence homology based on transcriptome-assembled sequence and known AMPs in databases.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (70.59%) toCl-CATH2R:21%; G:18%; L=F: 12%. GRAVY: -0.28; M Wt: 3975.762; Mol formula:  C182H298N62O38; molar extinction coeff: 0.Activity: it exhibited antimicrobial activity against E. coli MTCC 739 (MIC 90 ug/ml), S. aureus MTCC 737 (MIC 75 ug/ml), and B. cereus clinical isolate (MIC 100 ug/ml).Toxicity: caused hemolysis of 2% human RBC (1 h incubation).Structure: it is helical in 50% TFE (CD). Updated 10/2023 after final publication.
Literature Information.Author: Kannoth S, Ali N, Prasanth GK, Arvind K, Mohany M, Hembrom PS, Sadanandan S, Vasu DA, Grace T. 2023
Literature Information.Title: Transcriptome analysis of Corvus splendens reveals a repertoire of antimicrobial peptides.
